arts.ttl: Controversial late penalty gives Club Brugge win over Atalanta
arts.sum: Gustaf Nilsson wins and scores a controversial late penalty as Club Brugge claim a narrow lead over Atalanta in the first leg of their Champions League knockout play-off tie.

arts.ttl: “No One Would Say That Was a Penalty”: De Ketelaere Criticizes Referee After Atalanta’s Loss
arts.sum: Atalanta midfielder Charles De Ketelaere voiced his frustration following his team’s 2-1 defeat to Club Brugge in the first leg of their Champions League playoff. The match was decided by a controversial stoppage-time penalty that left the Belgian player, a former Brugge star, deeply dissatisfied. The post “No One Would Say That Was a Penalty”: De Ketelaere Criticizes Referee After Atalanta’s Loss appeared first on FootItalia.com.

arts.ttl: Club Brugge gets disputed late penalty to beat Atalanta 2-1 in Champions League playoffs
arts.sum: Club Brugge scored with a disputed penalty kick in stoppage time to beat Atalanta 2-1 in the first leg of their Champions League playoff on Wednesday. Bayern joins Real Madrid and Manchester City as Champions League title winners in the past five years who surprisingly found themselves in the knockout playoffs.

arts.ttl: Champions League | Club Brugge 2-1 Atalanta: Match Report
